entry.title: GOVERNOR ANNOUNCES THAT OREGONIANS NOW HAVE ACCESS TO SNAP BENEFITS
entry.summary: November 7, 2025 10:50 a.m. Thursday afternoon, a federal court ordered the Trump administration to immediately release 100 percent of funding to pay for Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program benefits for all recipients nationwide by Friday, including more than 750,000 Oregonians. A release from the Governor’s Office said following Governor Tina Kotek’s directive, the Oregon Department...

entry.title: Pretrial Motions Filed in Oakland Homicide Case
entry.summary: Attorneys for Dwayne Michael Lauka have filed multiple motions ahead of his February trial in the death of Terry Lea Deane, including a challenge to palm print evidence. Prosecutors maintain the evidence is valid and relevant to the case.

entry.title: Oregon Taxpayers to Receive 9.863% “Kicker” Credit After $1.41 Billion Surplus
entry.summary: Oregon residents will receive a 9.863% “kicker” credit on 2025 tax returns after a $1.41 billion surplus was confirmed. The credit will boost refunds or reduce taxes owed, with details available through the Oregon Department of Revenue.

entry.title: Oregon SNAP Benefits Fully Restored After Federal Court Ruling
entry.summary: Oregonians can now access their full November SNAP benefits after a federal court ordered the Trump Administration to release withheld funds. The Oregon Department of Human Services confirmed payments are restored, following Gov. Tina Kotek’s declaration of a hunger emergency.

entry.summary: DINT detectives arrested 38-year-old Chet Evans of Myrtle Creek in Roseburg after finding suspected fentanyl, meth residue, and weapons. Evans faces drug and weapons charges and remains in custody on a Lane County probation detainer.

entry.title: Southbound I-5 semi-truck fire near Winston extinguished
entry.summary: Fire crews extinguished a semi-truck fire on I-5 southbound near Winston Thursday morning. The blaze started in the engine compartment and spread to the cab and trailer loaded with paper rolls. No injuries were reported, and the cause is under investigation.

entry.title: Appeal Filed in Fatal UCC Softball Team Crash Case
entry.summary: A notice of appeal has been filed in the case of Jonathan Dowdy, sentenced to over 20 years for the fatal UCC softball team bus crash. Records show his sentence matched the plea agreement, and his earliest possible release date remains March 22, 2044.

entry.title: Oregon Connections 2025 Brings Together Broadband Leaders in Hood River
entry.summary: The 2025 Oregon Connections Telecommunications Conference brought more than 255 participants to Hood River for two days of learning, discussion, and connection. Broadband leaders, policymakers, and innovators from across Oregon gathered to share insights and advance the state’s work toward reliable, high-speed connectivity for all communities. entry.title: Grants Pass Awards $1.2 Million Homelessness Grant to Roseburg Developer
entry.summary: Grants Pass re-awarded a $1.2 million homelessness grant to Roseburg’s Elk Island Trading Group, which plans to build a container-home village for 150 people by summer 2026. The project could help the city close unmanaged camps and meet shelter space requirements.

entry.title: Umpqua Valley Festival of Lights Returns for 32nd Year
entry.summary: The 32nd annual Umpqua Valley Festival of Lights opens Nov. 23 at River Forks Park! Enjoy over half a million lights, 90+ displays, the World’s Largest Nutcracker, and the Dutch Bros Holiday Village. Open nightly at 5:30 p.m. through Jan. 1. More at UVFestivalofLights.com.

entry.title: Stewart Park “Green Bridge” Reopens - and It’s No Longer Green
entry.summary: Roseburg’s iconic “Green Bridge” has reopened after months of rehabilitation work, but it’s now black. Crews completed repairs, deck upgrades, and repainting to extend the bridge’s life and improve safety, restoring a key route between Stewart Parkway and the VA Medical Center.

entry.title: UCAN Preparing to Open Roseburg Warming Center for Third Winter
entry.summary: UCAN is reopening the Roseburg Warming Center for a third winter, offering warmth, food, and shelter during freezing nights. The center opens when temps drop to 30°F or below. Volunteers and donations are needed—sign up at housinghomelessservices.as.me/volunteerorientation.

entry.title: Securing Your Future: Choosing the Right Financing for Your Business Property
entry.summary: For a growing business, the decision to move from leasing to owning commercial real estate (CRE) represents a major strategic inflection point. While leasing offers flexibility and capital preservation in the short term, ownership is a powerful long-term tool for stability, wealth creation, and operational control. Once the decision to buy is made, securing the… The post Securing Your Future: Choosing the Right Financing for Your Business Property appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Douglas County Man Arrested on Felony Sexual Abuse Charge
entry.summary: Douglas County deputies arrested 43-year-old Jason Nathaniel Briggs on Oct. 31 for first-degree sexual abuse, a Class B felony. Investigators say the victim, a minor known to Briggs, reported years of abuse. He remains in the Douglas County Jail.

entry.title: USDA Blocks SNAP Discount, but Roseburg Grocery Outlet Finds a Way to Help
entry.summary: Roseburg Grocery Outlet’s planned 10% discount for SNAP recipients was blocked by the USDA, but owners Steve and Kelly Burton found a workaround—partnering with FISH Food Pantry to offer 10% off cards to anyone in need throughout November, no verification required.

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 11.4.25
entry.summary: From Aviva Health, Sarah Holborow and Dr. Gray Dawson talk about Thursday’s Vet and Their Pets event.

entry.title: Beef Quality Assurance class in Roseburg cancelled
entry.summary: The Oregon State University Douglas Extension Service announced that the Roseburg location of the Beef Quality Assurance Cow-Calf class is cancelled due to low registration numbers.

entry.title: Douglas County Joins Operation Green Light to Honor Veterans
entry.summary: Douglas County will again take part in Operation Green Light this November, lighting the courthouse green to honor veterans and their families. Residents are encouraged to join by displaying a green light at home to show gratitude and support for those who have served.

entry.title: Douglas County Search and Rescue Locates Two Missing Men
entry.summary: Douglas County Search and Rescue located two missing men in separate incidents last week. A Myrtle Creek hunter was found safe Friday morning, and an Eugene man stuck in the Umpqua National Forest was located Sunday evening in good health after being stranded for four days.

entry.title: November 4, 2025
entry.summary: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop

entry.title: WIND ADVISORY FOR MUCH OF REGION STARTS TUESDAY AFTERNOON
entry.summary: November 4, 2025 4:00 a.m. A Wind Advisory remains in effect for much of the region from Tuesday afternoon at 4:00 p.m. until 7:00 a.m. Wednesday. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford said southeast winds of 25 to 35 miles per hour with gusts up to 50 miles per hour are expected. The...

entry.title: MERKLEY BLASTS SENATE REPUBLICANS FOR BLOCKING RESOLTION
entry.summary: November 4, 2025 3:50 a.m. Late Monday, Oregon’s U.S. Senator Jeff Merkley denounced Senate Republicans for blocking his resolution with Senate Democratic Leader Chuck Schumer to force President Trump to immediately use all congressionally approved funding to keep families from going hungry. Merkley said, “President Trump has a new MAHA strategy – the ‘Make America...

entry.title: SEARCH AND RESCUE LOCATES TWO MISSING MEN
entry.summary: November 4, 2025 3:40 a.m. Douglas County Sheriff’s Office Search and Rescue has located two missing men in recent days. A DCSO report said 61-year-old Darwin Trimnell of Myrtle Creek was reported missing after not returning to his hunting party on Thursday, October 30th around 9:00 p.m. A deputy initiated a SAR call out and...

entry.title: DOUGLAS COUNTY PARTICIPATING IN OPERATION GREEN LIGHT
entry.summary: November 4, 2025 3:30 a.m. The Douglas County Board of Commissioners have announced that the county will again participate in Operation Green Light. During the month of November, as part of Veterans and Military Families Month, the front of the courthouse will be illuminated with green lights to show appreciation and support for veterans and...

entry.title: UCAN FOOD BANK PARTNERING WITH COLUMBIA BANK FOR FOOD DRIVE
entry.summary: November 4, 2025 3:20 a.m. The United Community Action Network Food Bank is partnering with Columbia Bank for a month-long food drive. It will take place throughout November at all Columbia Bank locations in Douglas County. Each branch will be collecting food donations on weekdays from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. All donations will go...

entry.title: UCC FOUNDATION WITH 9TH ANNUAL LEGACY BALL ON FRIDAY NIGHT
entry.summary: November 4, 2025 3:05 a.m. The Umpqua Community College Foundation’s 9th annual Legacy Ball is happening this Friday night. Doors will open at 5:30 p.m. at Seven Feathers Casino and Resort in Canyonville. The theme is “Havana Nights” with the evening set to include an unforgettable celebration, Cuban-inspired cuisine, and lively entertainment. Music will be...

entry.title: “HAVE YOURSELF A CRAZY LITTLE CHRISTMAS” WITH UACT
entry.summary: November 4, 2025 2:50 a.m. In the KQEN Cultural Spotlight: Umpqua Actors Community Theatre presents, “Have Yourself a Crazy Little Christmas”, on stage in December.
